teachers take attendance in school which

in 2004 an experiment was conducted by a
professor M Bertrand he had his team of
researchers respond to about 5,000 job
applications in the Boston and Chicago
area he sent out identical resumes with
different names
one group of common names like Emily
Gregory and John and the other group
with more diverse names like Ayesha
Jamal Darnell what they found was
somewhat disturbing resumes with common
names had a 10% rate of callback while
resumes with more diverse names only had
a 6.5 rate of call back they then
submitted better resumes to see if there
would be a change in result better
resumes with common names saw a 27%
increase in call back so a total of 37
percent while these same better resumes
with diverse names saw only an 8 percent
increase in callbacks
so total of 40
in point five percent so it seems that
